text: al_wait_for_event waits until the event queue specified is non-empty. If ret_eventis not NULL, the first event in the queue will be copied into ret_event and removed from the queue. If ret_event is NULL the first event is left at the head of the queue.

speaker: Programmer
text: what states can allegro_keyboard_state be in

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_KEYBOARD_STATE is a structure that is used to hold a "snapshot" of a keyboard\'s state at a particular instant.

speaker: Apiza
text: It contains the following publically readable fields: display - points to the display that had keyboard focus at the time the state was saved. If no display was focused, this points to NULL.\n

speaker: Apiza
text: You cannot read the state of keys directly. Use the function al_key_down.

speaker: Programmer
text: what's the event type for a key press

speaker: Apiza
text: The method retrieves the keyboard event source. All keyboard events are generated by this event source.\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns NULL if the keyboard subsystem was not installed.

speaker: Programmer
text: what is the keyboard event type called

speaker: Apiza
text: Are you asking about one of the following?

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_DOWN represents a keyboard key was pressed.

speaker: Apiza
text: Note: this event is about the physical keys being pressed on the keyboard. Look for ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_CHAR events for character input.

speaker: Apiza
text: An ALLEGRO_EVENT is a union of all builtin event structures, i.e. it is an object large enough to hold the data of any event type.

speaker: Apiza
text:
All events have the following fields in common:

type (ALLEGRO_EVENT_TYPE)
Indicates the type of event.
any.source (ALLEGRO_EVENT_SOURCE *)
The event source which generated the event.
any.timestamp (double)
When the event was generated.
By examining the type field you can then access type-specific fields. The any.source field tells you which event source generated that particular event. The any.timestamp field tells you when the event was generated. The time is referenced to the same starting point as al_get_time.

speaker: Apiza
text: Each event is of one of the following types, with the usable fields given.

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_DOWN represents a keyboard key was pressed.

speaker: Programmer
text: if I have an ALLEGRO_EVENT called ev, should ev.type == ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_DOWN return true when I press a key?

text: Are you interested in al_get_keyboard_state or al_key_down?

speaker: Apiza
text: This method saves the state of the keyboard specified at the time the function is called into the structure pointed to by ret_state.

speaker: Apiza
text: The method retrieves the keyboard event source. All keyboard events are generated by this event source.\n

speaker: Apiza

speaker: Apiza
text: This method installs a keyboard driver.

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns true if successful. If a driver was already installed, nothing happens and true is returned.

speaker: Programmer
text: what are the fields of ALLEGRO_EVENT_SOURCE

speaker: Apiza
text: An event source is any object which can generate events. For example, an ALLEGRO_DISPLAY can generate events, and you can get the ALLEGRO_EVENT_SOURCE pointer from an ALLEGRO_DISPLAY with al_get_display_event_source.\n\nYou may create your own "user" event sources that emit custom events.

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns true if the key specified was held down in the state specified.
